net.proteusframework.cms.component.generator

Class ContentWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.cms.component.generator.ContentWrapper

  • public final class ContentWrapper
extends Object
    Content wrapper for Generators.

    This serves a couple purposes:

    • Provide consistent HTML for design.
    • Allow CMS to inject content into the page: preview support, domain model context, auto-AJAX, etc.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Field Detail

      • LEGACY_FLOAT_CLEAR

        public static final boolean LEGACY_FLOAT_CLEAR
        The constant LEGACY_FLOAT_CLEAR. True indicates that content generators should output the old style clearing DIVs for containers that may contain floated elements.

      • addAttribute

        public ContentWrapper addAttribute(String key,
                          String value)
        Add an attribute to the content wrapper. If this is called multiple times with the same key, then the values are output space separated (doesn't apply to the ID attribute).
        Parameters:
        key - the key. May be null.
        value - the value. May be null.
        Returns:
        this.

      • outputPageElementURLAttribute

        public ContentWrapper outputPageElementURLAttribute(net.proteusframework.internet.http.ResponseURL url)
        Configure to output the page element URL attribute. Use this method to add parameters, make it partial, etc.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL. Must be for this page element.
        Returns:
        this.

      • renderDynamicContentDependencies

        public ContentWrapper renderDynamicContentDependencies()
        Conditionally render any dependencies (e.g. CSS, JS) required by code generated in this request to be loaded via AJAX or similar methods. Typically, this is called prior to calling RenderChain.renderChildElements().

        Unless the request is partial, the negotiated content type is for HTML, and the PageElement being processed is the top-level PageElement, this is a no-op. In order for this to work, the page must already have the appropriate loader - CmsJsLibrary.CMS_INCLUDE.

        Returns:
        this.

      • setElement

        public ContentWrapper setElement(net.proteusframework.core.html.Element element)
        Set the element name to output.
        Parameters:
        element - the element name.
        Returns:
        this.

        public ContentWrapper setElementName(String elementName)
        Set the element name to output. Defaults to "div".
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setIdAttribute

        public ContentWrapper setIdAttribute(String value)
        Set the ID attribute to the content wrapper. It is up to the caller to make sure that this value is unique.
        Parameters:
        value - the value. May be null.
        Returns:
        this.

      • setOutputWrapperForTopLevelPageElement

        public ContentWrapper setOutputWrapperForTopLevelPageElement(boolean outputWrapperForTopLevelPageElement)
        Set the output wrapper for top level PageElement flag. Defaults to true. If set, to false and the PageElement associated to the PageElementPath is this PageElement being rendered, then the wrapper does not output anything. This must be called before open().
        Parameters:
        outputWrapperForTopLevelPageElement - the outputWrapperForTopLevelPageElement.
        Returns:
        this.

      • setStandardClassName

        public ContentWrapper setStandardClassName(String standardClassName)
        Set the standard class name. If one isn't specified, the PageElement class name is used. For backward compatibility, the PageElement class name is still used for HTML4 in addition to the class passed into this method.
        Parameters:
        standardClassName - the standard class name.
        Returns:
        this.

      • setStandardClassName

        public ContentWrapper setStandardClassName(String standardClassName,
                                  net.proteusframework.core.html.HTMLDoctype minVersion)
        Set the standard class name.
        Parameters:
        standardClassName - the standard class name.
        minVersion - the min version this applies.
        Returns:
        this.
